summary: For the global Muslim population, Malaysia is an attractive travel destination not just because of its unique culture, nature and tourist attractions but also because of its Muslim-friendly environment and services.

title: Fixed-income assets such as bonds to star in 2024
summary: SINGAPORE: The US Federal Reserve’s (Fed) pivot towards interest rate cuts in 2024 is expected to create more opportunities in fixed-income assets such as bonds, says the Bank of Singapore (BoS).

title: Chengdu issite for BOE’s US$8.8bildiode unit
summary: CHENGDU: Chinese semiconductor display manufacturer BOE Technology Group Co Ltd says it will invest US$8.8bil to set up a new active-matrix organic light-emitting diode or amoled production line in Chengdu, capital of south-west China’s Sichuan province.
content:
CHENGDU: Chinese semiconductor display manufacturer BOE Technology Group Co Ltd says it will invest US$8.8bil to set up a new active-matrix organic light-emitting diode or amoled production line in Chengdu, capital of south-west China’s Sichuan province.

The display giant signed an investment cooperation agreement on an 8.6th generation amoled production line with Chengdu Hi-Tech Industrial Development Zone last Wednesday, mainly to produce high-end touchscreens used in elec

title: TV show brings justice to UK’s post office scandal
summary: London: Seema Misra was pregnant when she was wrongfully found guilty of stealing from the Post Office she ran in a small town south-west of London.
content:
Former sub-postmistress Seema Misra, who was wrongly imprisoned, poses for a photograph at her home in Knaphill on January 12, 2024. (Photo by HENRY NICHOLLS / AFP) / TO GO WITH AFP STORY BY Sylvain PEUCHMAURD

London: Seema Misra was pregnant when she was wrongfully found guilty of stealing from the Post Office she ran in a small town south-west of London.

title: LG opens first US EV charger factory in Texas
summary: TEXAS: LG Electronics Inc has opened its first electric vehicle (EV) charger factory outside of South Korea – in Fort Worth here – as the company targets the North American market.
content:
Charging ahead: An EV charger from LG being exhibited at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, Nevada recently. LG is looking to tap into the North American market as it aims to become a global leader in EV charging. — AFP

TEXAS: LG Electronics Inc has opened its first electric vehicle (EV) charger factory outside of South Korea – in Fort Worth here – as the company targets the North American market.

title: Argentina’s Caputo brokers deal with the IMF he once battled
summary: Buenos Aires: The last time Luis Caputo negotiated with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), fierce disagreements over how to manage Argentina’s struggling currency caused him to quit his job as the country’s central bank chief.
content:
FILE PHOTO: The IMF logo is seen outside the headquarters building in Washington

Buenos Aires: The last time Luis Caputo negotiated with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), fierce disagreements over how to manage Argentina’s struggling currency caused him to quit his job as the country’s central bank chief.

A little more than five years later, Caputo is back for a second act, and the IMF that forced his exit during those 2018 talks is cheering his in

title: Biden’s methane fee aims at reducing oil industry pollution
summary: WASHINGTON: The Biden administration has unveiled its plan for a new fee on methane emissions from the oil and gas industry it says will prod companies to move more rapidly to stifle leaks of the potent greenhouse gas.
content:
A file photo of a flare burning off methane at an oil well.. — AP

WASHINGTON: The Biden administration has unveiled its plan for a new fee on methane emissions from the oil and gas industry it says will prod companies to move more rapidly to stifle leaks of the potent greenhouse gas.

The fee – as much as US$1,500 per tonne in 2026 – was mandated by Congress as part of the 2022 Inflation Reduction Act, but lawmakers left key details up to the Environment

title: Price drop leads to calls for stimulus
summary: Beijing: China’s consumer prices dropped for the third consecutive month in December, indicating subdued demand and prompting calls for additional stimulus measures to invigorate domestic demand and encourage consumption.
content:
A fruit vendor attends to a customer at an outdoor market in Beijing, China January 12, 2024. REUTERS/Florence Lo

Beijing: China’s consumer prices dropped for the third consecutive month in December, indicating subdued demand and prompting calls for additional stimulus measures to invigorate domestic demand and encourage consumption.

While China’s continued economic recovery is still facing pressures from insufficient demand, analysts said China is capa

title: Costco opens new                Shenzhen store
summary: SHENZHEN: US retail giant Costco Wholesale has opened a new store in the city of Shenzhen, South China’s Guangdong province, which is the sixth Costco store on the Chinese mainland.
content:
SHENZHEN: US retail giant Costco Wholesale has opened a new store in the city of Shenzhen, South China’s Guangdong province, which is the sixth Costco store on the Chinese mainland.

The store, located in Longhua district, covers a total area of 44,500 sq m with nearly 15,000 sq m of shopping space.

The opening of the store marks a crucial step in the retail giant’s expansion into South China.

Hordes of consumers flooded into the store last Friday morning.<

title: Volvo Malaysia awaits details on HVGT, hopes EV adoption rises
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Volvo Malaysia hopes that the soon-to-be-implemented High-Value Goods Tax (HVGT) will be given careful consideration to ensure that the luxury tax does not undermine efforts to encourage Malaysians to switch to electric vehicles (EVs).
content:
IAA truck show in Hanover

KUALA LUMPUR: Volvo Malaysia hopes that the soon-to-be-implemented High-Value Goods Tax (HVGT) will be given careful consideration to ensure that the luxury tax does not undermine efforts to encourage Malaysians to switch to electric vehicles (EVs).

Managing director Charles Frump said the Swedish carmaker is still waiting for details on the luxury tax.

summary: PETALING JAYA: MR DIY Group (M) Bhd’s focused growth plans are set to drive the group’s earnings performance going forward.

title: With new taxes come shared responsibilities
summary: This year is set to be a year when Malaysia fortifies its fiscal foundations to ensure the people’s wellbeing, as evidenced by the government taking serious steps to diversify its tax base to ensure stable and sustainable revenue streams.
content:
This year is set to be a year when Malaysia fortifies its fiscal foundations to ensure the people’s wellbeing, as evidenced by the government taking serious steps to diversify its tax base to ensure stable and sustainable revenue streams.

title: Oil consumption and prices forecast to rise
summary: GLOBAL consumption of petroleum and other liquids hit a record high last year and is forecast to increase further in both 2024 and 2025, but that does not necessarily mean prices must rise to ensure demand is met.
content:
Continuing trend: A file photo of an oil pump in the United States. Consumption of oil has trended upwards for more than a century. — AP

GLOBAL consumption of petroleum and other liquids hit a record high last year and is forecast to increase further in both 2024 and 2025, but that does not necessarily mean prices must rise to ensure demand is met.

Worldwide consumption averaged 101.1 million barrels per day (bpd) in 2023, narrowly beating the pr

title: Shein seeks China’s permission for US listing
summary: HONG KONG: Shein is seeking Beijing’s nod to go public in the United States, highlighting the limits of the fashion company’s efforts to present itself as global rather than a Chinese company, according to sources.
content:
Complicated deal: People at the Shein pop-up shop in Times Square’s Forever 21 in New York City. In a sign of the likely fraught nature of the application process, the SEC has yet to respond to Shein’s IPO filing. — Reuters

HONG KONG: Shein is seeking Beijing’s nod to go public in the United States, highlighting the limits of the fashion company’s efforts to present itself as global rather than a Chinese company, according to sources.

title: Russian billionaire blames Sotheby’s for bad art deals
summary: New York: Russian billionaire Dmitry Rybolovlev told a New York jury that he was a mere novice in the mysterious world of high-end art sales and expected Sotheby’s auction house to protect clients from what he describes as rogue art dealers.
content:
Dmitry Rybolovlev, president of As Monaco Football Club SA, left, arrives at court in New York, US, on Tuesday, Jan. 9, 2024. Auction house Sothebys abused its privilege, power and reputation to help dupe Russian billionaire Dmitry Rybolovlev out of millions of dollars as he built a world-class art collection, lawyers for the wealthy businessman argued on the first day of a closely-watched trial. Photographer: Jeenah Moon/Bloomberg

title: Shopee records one million local streamers
summary: PETALING JAYA: Shopee, the leading eCommerce platform in South-East Asia and Taiwan, has demonstrated Malaysia’s inclusive digital economy by concluding 2023 with over one million Malaysians registered to stream on Shopee Live and over 450,000 new homegrown sellers, influencers and affiliates in its ecosystem nationwide.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Shopee, the leading eCommerce platform in South-East Asia and Taiwan, has demonstrated Malaysia’s inclusive digital economy by concluding 2023 with over one million Malaysians registered to stream on Shopee Live and over 450,000 new homegrown sellers, influencers and affiliates in its ecosystem nationwide.

Shopee Live is a livestream platform on Shopee app that lets a person watch product-related content and interact directly with sellers.

title: CES highlights the climate-centric future of consumer technology
summary: NEW YORK: Perusing the halls of the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) usually means watching robot dogs dance and checking out the latest TVs amid the dull roar of the ever-present crowd. Those things still happen at CES.
content:
Attendees ride a "Hydrogen Fuel Cell Train" at the SK booth during the 2024 CES in Las Vegas. Hydrogen was one of the technologies being touted at the trade show. Photographer: Bridget Bennett/Bloomberg

NEW YORK: Perusing the halls of the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) usually means watching robot dogs dance and checking out the latest TVs amid the dull roar of the ever-present crowd. Those things still happen at CES.

title: Fresh strategies needed to face the new year
summary: HANOI: The world and domestic economic situation in 2024 will continue to have difficulties and challenges, according to experts and in this context, Vietnamese businesses need to proactively implement solutions to promote production and sales.
content:
HANOI: The world and domestic economic situation in 2024 will continue to have difficulties and challenges, according to experts and in this context, Vietnamese businesses need to proactively implement solutions to promote production and sales.

Experts have pointed out that some export industries have good signals because they have exhausted foreign inventories.

However, some other industries are still facing difficulties due to consumers tightening their spending.

title: Bursa likely to trade on a cautious note this week
summary: PETALING JAYA: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade on a cautious note this week given the major change in the macro situation following the United States higher-than-expected inflation print, which would push back the interest rate cut expectation.
content:
PETALING JAYA: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade on a cautious note this week given the major change in the macro situation following the United States higher-than-expected inflation print, which would push back the interest rate cut expectation.

title: Dr M shouldn’t question loyalty of Malaysian Chinese, Indians
summary: Former prime minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad should not question the loyalty of Malaysians of Indian and Chinese descent just because they speak their mother tongue and adhere to their own culture and customs, said Digital Minister Gobind Singh Deo.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Jan 14): Former prime minister Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad should not question the loyalty of Malaysians of Indian and Chinese descent just because they speak their mother tongue and adhere to their own culture and customs, said Digital Minister Gobind Singh Deo.

In a statement on Sunday, the DAP national deputy chairman said this was because Malaysia was a multi-ethnic country with citizens from various religious and cultural backgrounds.

"It is unfortun

title: Azalina: Fixed-term bill to be studied, not borne out of desperation
summary: The proposal to enact a law for a fixed parliamentary term is not a desperate move, Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Law and Institutional Reform) Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Jan 14): The proposal to enact a law for a fixed parliamentary term is not a desperate move, Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Law and Institutional Reform) Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said.

Rather, it reflects the commitment by the unity government to respect the electoral mandate and democratic processes and to ensure political stability amid uncertain geopolitical situations, she said.

As such, the proposal from Deputy Prime Minister Datuk

title: Proposed fixed-term bill would foster greater stability for govt of the day — Ahmad Maslan
summary: Highlighting the significance of ensuring political stability, Umno supreme council member Datuk Seri Ahmad Maslan said it is important to address the proposal to enact a law for the uninterrupted governance of a government for a full term.
content:
PONTIAN (Jan 14): Highlighting the significance of ensuring political stability, Umno supreme council member Datuk Seri Ahmad Maslan said it is important to address the proposal to enact a law for the uninterrupted governance of a government for a full term.

He emphasised that such legislation would empower the party securing a mandate in a general election to lead the nation and advance its development agenda without being vulnerable to attempts to overthrow it.

title: South Korea says it will impose fines on two global banks for short-selling violations
summary: SEOUL: South Korea's financial regulator on Sunday said it plans to impose penalties on two unnamed global investment banks it is investigating.The Financial Services Commission said it found two global investment banks were engaged in the practice of ...
content:
SEOUL: South Korea's financial regulator on Sunday said it plans to impose penalties on two unnamed global investment banks it is investigating.

The Financial Services Commission said it found two global investment banks were engaged in the practice of naked short-selling transactions, which involves selling shares without borrowing them first.

The FSC did not identify their names.

South Korea has been widening a probe into global investment banks to weed out illegal short-sellers from the local stock market af

title: Woman claims lost over RM500,000 to Facebook investment scam
summary: A local woman lost more than half a million ringgit after allegedly falling victim to a non-existent investment scheme advertised on Facebook.
content:
JOHOR BAHRU (Jan 14): A local woman lost more than half a million ringgit after allegedly falling victim to a non-existent investment scheme advertised on Facebook.

Batu Pahat district police chief ACP Ismail Dollah said the 54-year-old woman claimed to have communicated with a woman from China via WhatsApp after clicking on a Facebook link promoting the investment offer in October last year.

The victim was then told to download an application and provide her de

title: CPO futures likely to trade with upward bias next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with an upward bias next week given expectations of a weaker output due to seasonal factors, said palm oil trader David Ng.He ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with an upward bias next week given expectations of a weaker output due to seasonal factors, said palm oil trader David Ng.

He said the continued strength in external markets for soybean oil and crude oil is expected to boost market sentiment in the near term.

"We expect CPO futures to trade with an upward bias with prices looking to test the RM3,950 level. Support can be seen around the RM3,700 level," he told Berna

title: Ringgit likely to see cautious trading next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to continue trading cautiously next week, as investors await a slew of economic data scheduled to be released by several major economies.Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to continue trading cautiously next week, as investors await a slew of economic data scheduled to be released by several major economies.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said next week, the focus would be on China's fourth-quarter 2023 gross domestic product numbers which will be released on Wednesday, along with the United Kingdom and European Union's consumer price index (CPI).

title: Water supply in Penang fully restored, says PBAPP
summary: Water supply to a total of 590,000 users in the state, who have been affected by a scheduled water supply disruption for four days starting Jan 10, has been fully restored on Sunday, said the Perbadanan Bekalan Air Pulau Pinang (PBAPP).
content:
GEORGE TOWN (Jan 14): Water supply to a total of 590,000 users in the state, who have been affected by a scheduled water supply disruption for four days starting Jan 10, has been fully restored on Sunday, said the Perbadanan Bekalan Air Pulau Pinang (PBAPP).

PBAPP said that the third and fourth stages of supply restoration involved 99.5% of the 590,000 affected users in Seberang Perai and the island part of the state and the remaining 0.5% of affected users in the end-of-line (EOL) and hilly areas in the south

title: Rising shelter, healthcare costs boost US consumer inflation in December
summary: WASHINGTON: U.S. consumer prices increased more than expected in December as Americans paid more for shelter and healthcare, suggesting that it was probably too early for the Federal Reserve to start cutting interest rates.Expectations for a rate cut ...
content:
WASHINGTON: U.S. consumer prices increased more than expected in December as Americans paid more for shelter and healthcare, suggesting that it was probably too early for the Federal Reserve to start cutting interest rates.

Expectations for a rate cut in March were also tempered by other data on Thursday showing the labor market remaining tight at the turn of the year, with the number of people filing new claims for unemployment benefits unexpectedly falling last week. The reports followed news last Friday that the economy adde

title: Bank Islam, SOSEA seal financing tie-up
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Bank Islam Malaysia Bhd and the Sabah Social Entrepreneurs Association (SOSEA) have inked a strategic collaboration agreement in order to support the growth of social entrepreneurs and provide members with greater access to financing.  By signing this agreement, ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bank Islam Malaysia Bhd and the Sabah Social Entrepreneurs Association (SOSEA) have inked a strategic collaboration agreement in order to support the growth of social entrepreneurs and provide members with greater access to financing.

  By signing this agreement, Bank Islam has effectively designated SOSEA as its change-maker where the association will work with the bank to implement its social finance agenda.

title: Wellington college for Johor?
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Singaporean billionaire Peter Lim, one of Johor's biggest financiers, plans to build an international college in the Iskandar area.Lim is excited about developments in the Johor Bahru-Singapore rapid transit system (RTS), which is scheduled for completion ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Singaporean billionaire Peter Lim, one of Johor's biggest financiers, plans to build an international college in the Iskandar area.

Lim is excited about developments in the Johor Bahru-Singapore rapid transit system (RTS), which is scheduled for completion in 2026.

His company, Wellington College International Regional Management (WCIRM), in partnership with Wellington College International (WCI), is looking into plans to establish Wellington College in the Iskandar area.

title: Over five groups to present their concept proposals for KL-S'pore bullet train on Monday
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: More than five consortiums comprising domestic and foreign engineering, technology, piling, and infrastructure construction firms are expected to present their concept proposals for the development of the Kuala Lumpur-Singapore high-speed rail (KL-SG HSR).  The deadline for the consortiums ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: More than five consortiums comprising domestic and foreign engineering, technology, piling, and infrastructure construction firms are expected to present their concept proposals for the development of the Kuala Lumpur-Singapore high-speed rail (KL-SG HSR).

  The deadline for the consortiums to submit their concept proposals for the KL-Singapore HSR line's Request For Information (RFI) is January 15, 2024.

title: KJTS aims to boost regional footprint
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: KJTS Group Bhd, which is slated to be listed on the Ace Market of Bursa Malaysia this month, aims to enhance its regional footprint using the proceeds from its initial public offering (IPO). Out of the total proceeds ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: KJTS Group Bhd, which is slated to be listed on the Ace Market of Bursa Malaysia this month, aims to enhance its regional footprint using the proceeds from its initial public offering (IPO). 

Out of the total proceeds of RM58.87 million, it will utilise a significant portion for expansion purposes from this year until 2026.

title: More Malaysians turning to precious metal for stability amid global uncertainties, said Habib
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The price of gold is intricately woven into the fabric of global events and escalating geopolitical tensions, particularly in the Middle East and between China and Taiwan, are among the key drivers that can push the precious metal ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The price of gold is intricately woven into the fabric of global events and escalating geopolitical tensions, particularly in the Middle East and between China and Taiwan, are among the key drivers that can push the precious metal towards new highs.

"Gold price has seemed to be inversely correlated to the US dollar over the past year. The US dollar's recent retreat paved the way for gold prices to breach the US$2,000 per ounce mark.

title: Timeless threads
summary: Michael Fischbacher, chief executive officer of the 205-year-old Christian Fischbacher, was in Kuala Lumpur last year to celebrate the luxury Swiss interior fabrics brand’s collaboration with Malaysian artist Rebecca Duckett-Wilkinson. The company brought out a capsule collection of curtains, upholstery and rugs featuring patterns taken from paintings Rebecca did during the Covid lockdown in her country house in Italy.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 14): Michael Fischbacher, chief executive officer of the 205-year-old Christian Fischbacher, was in Kuala Lumpur last year to celebrate the luxury Swiss interior fabrics brand’s collaboration with Malaysian artist Rebecca Duckett-Wilkinson. The company brought out a capsule collection of curtains, upholstery and rugs featuring patterns taken from paintings Rebecca did during the Covid lockdown in her country house in Italy.

title: Next level of growth
summary: IOI Properties Group Bhd is expanding its business with more launches of high-end properties in Malaysia and Singapore and aims to increase its annual revenue of RM2 billion to RM2.5 billion, says newly appointed group chief executive officer Lee Yeow Seng.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 14): IOI Properties Group Bhd is expanding its business with more launches of high-end properties in Malaysia and Singapore and aims to increase its annual revenue of RM2 billion to RM2.5 billion, says newly appointed group chief executive officer Lee Yeow Seng.

“We want to increase our annual sales by launching high-value projects [locally and abroad]. In Malaysia, we are looking at two flagship projects, which are Bandar Puteri Puchong and IOI
Resort City," he says.
